intro: Ptyssiglottis glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Ptyssiglottis glandulifera is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
